revised_title: Exploring Heterogeneities in Transmission Rates and their Impact on Schistosome Infections
tldr: This article investigates the effects of heterogeneous transmission rates on the epidemiology of schistosome infections. The authors find that differences in contact patterns among individuals and sites can significantly impact the basic reproductive rate of the infection. They apply their analysis to field data from a community in Zimbabwe, suggesting that targeted control efforts could be more effective by focusing on specific sites and individuals with higher transmission rates.
